alert.note: Alert for Archer; Baylor; Clay; Foard; Hardeman; Knox; Wichita; Wilbarger (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 01 at 3:19AM CST until February 03 at 6:00PM CST by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Accumulating snow and ice expected. Widespread snow totals of 1 to 3 inches possible across most of Oklahoma and western north Texas, with amounts of 4 to 6 inches possible across northern and central Oklahoma. In addition, ice accumulations near one-tenth of an inch or greater are possible. Higher ice totals appear possible across south central and southeast Oklahoma, and portions of northern Texas, with accumulations greater than one-quarter inch. * WHERE...Western two-thirds of Oklahoma and western north Texas. * WHEN...Tuesday evening through Thursday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could become very difficult. Stay up to date on road conditions and include a winter emergency kit if you must travel. Along with accumulating ice and snow, gusty north winds will create dangerous wind chills as low as 15 below zero. Precautions should be taken in order to prevent hypothermia. Limit outdoor exposure, try to cover all exposed skin, and dress in several layers of clothing.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Upgrades to Winter Storm Warnings or Advisories are likely later today.
